skill.name: ceo-personal-os
skill.description: This skill should be used when building a personal productivity or operating system for a CEO, founder, or executive. Triggers on "personal OS", "annual review", "life planning", "goal setting system", "Bill Campbell", "Trillion Dollar Coach", "startup failure patterns", "Good to Great", "Level 5 Leadership", "Buy Back Your Time", "E-Myth", "Customer Development", "Steve Blank", "Small Is Beautiful", "Schumacher", "human-scale", "subsidiarity", "Buddhist economics", "permanence".
skill.summary: This skill should be used when building a personal productivity or operating system for a CEO, found...
skill.author: 2389-research

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. All content is markdown-based executive coaching frameworks. Static findings are false positives: backticks are Markdown formatting, URLs are author attributions, and business terms were misidentified as security patterns.

content.user_title: Build your CEO personal operating system
content.value_statement: Executives lack structured reflection systems for strategic thinking. This skill provides 11 proven frameworks from Bill Campbell, Jim Collins, Dan Martell, and E.F. Schumacher to build lasting clarity and avoid productivity theater.
actual_capabilities: Run daily, weekly, quarterly, and annual reviews with framework-specific questions
Apply 11 coaching frameworks including Campbell, Collins, Eisenmann, and Schumacher
Generate interview-style prompts for self-reflection on people, time, and business roles
Extract patterns from past reviews to build long-term memory and insights
Design ideal lifestyle with TMI calculation and dreamline planning from Ferriss method
Diagnose startup failure patterns using Diamond-and-Square alignment framework
limitations: This is a reflection system, not a task manager or calendar integration
No automatic data collection from calendar, email, or external applications
User must manually complete reviews and upload past documents for pattern extraction
Does not integrate with external productivity tools, APIs, or third-party services

use_cases.title: Annual strategic reflection
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive year-end reviews using Gustin method with wins, lessons, relationships, and energy patterns

use_cases.title: Client coaching sessions
use_cases.description: Use Campbell coaching principles and interview scripts to guide clients through leadership development

use_cases.title: Venture health check
use_cases.description: Diagnose vulnerability to Eisenmann failure patterns and assess Diamond-Square alignment for business health

prompt_templates.title: Start annual review
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me run a full annual review using the Gustin framework. Ask me each question one by one.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze time use
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a time audit with me using the Martell DRIP matrix. What questions should I ask myself?

prompt_templates.title: Check venture health
prompt_templates.prompt: Which of the six Eisenmann failure patterns might my startup be vulnerable to? Walk me through the Diamond-Square framework.

prompt_templates.title: Build personal OS
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to build a complete CEO personal operating system. What directories and files do I need to create?

output_examples.input: Help me run my quarterly review
output: Daily Check: Energy level 1-10, one win, one friction, priority for tomorrow
Weekly Focus: What moved the needle vs. what was noise
Campbell Check: Who have I developed this quarter?
Eisenmann Check: Which failure patterns am I vulnerable to?
Martell Check: Am I in my Production Quadrant?
Gerber Check: Am I working ON or IN the business?
Schumacher Check: Am I building for permanence or extracting?

output_examples.input: I want to design my ideal lifestyle
output: First, describe your ideal day from morning to night
Then calculate the monthly cost of that lifestyle (housing, food, experiences, travel)
Add your savings goals and multiply by 1.3 for taxes and buffer
What is your Target Monthly Income (TMI)?
What is the gap between your current income and your TMI?
What is the fastest path to close that gap?
Customer Development Check: Are you testing hypotheses through customer discovery, or executing a known business model?
Key question: How much time do you spend outside the building talking to customers?
If you cannot clearly answer this, you may be executing without validation
Consider: When did you last pivot based on customer evidence?

best_practices: Start with daily checks (5 minutes max) and build up to quarterly reviews (2-3 hours) as you develop the habit
Upload past reviews to uploads/ folder so the skill can extract patterns and themes over time
Use the Campbell Yardstick question as your north star: Who have I helped become a great leader?
anti_patterns: Using generic frameworks like Eisenhower Matrix instead of the specified coaching frameworks
Converting this reflection system into a task manager with to-do lists and action items
Using hustle culture language like crush it, 10x your output, or optimize every minute

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It triggers on personal OS, annual review, and framework names.

faq.question: What is the time commitment for each review cadence?
faq.answer: Daily: 5 minutes max. Weekly: 30-45 minutes. Quarterly: 2-3 hours. Annual: 4-6 hours. Adjust based on your needs.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing calendar?
faq.answer: No. This is a standalone reflection system. You manually record insights after completing reviews in your own notes.

faq.question: Is my reflection data stored securely?
faq.answer: All data stays in your local ceo-personal-os directory. Nothing is sent to external servers. You control your own files.

faq.question: How is this different from other productivity systems?
faq.answer: This is a reflection system, not a task manager. It focuses on clarity over productivity theater using proven executive coaching frameworks.

faq.question: What frameworks are included?
faq.answer: 11 frameworks: Gustin Annual Review, Ferriss Lifestyle Costing, Robbins Vivid Vision, Lieberman Life Map, Campbell Coaching, Eisenmann Failure Patterns, Collins Good to Great, Martell Buy Back Your Time, Gerber E-Myth, Blank Customer Development, Schumacher Human-Scale Economics.
